head.title: National Briefing | West: Nevada: Mushroom Cloud Plates . . . Nah

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | West: Nevada: Mushroom Cloud Plates . . . Nah

abstract.p: Nevada officials reject design featuring mushroom cloud for special license plate to commemorate Nevada Test Site, where atmospheric tests of atomic bombs were carried out in 1950's and 1960's (S)

block.p: State officials have rejected a design featuring a mushroom cloud for a special license plate to commemorate the Nevada Test Site. The Legislature approved plans for a plate that would honor the history of the federal government's 1950's and 1960's atmospheric tests of atom bombs about 65 miles outside Las Vegas. Department of Motor Vehicles officials said the threat of nuclear war between India and Pakistan and the debate over the Yucca Mountain nuclear waste depository in the state influenced their decision. They added that the state still planned to have a license plate honoring its nuclear history but that a new and less controversial design would have to be chosen.
